input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is HPSEActor

1. Sets or changes the name of the host security group.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>set</command> <category>hostsecuritygroup</category> <process-id>update-host-security-group</process-id> <command-arguments> <hostsecuritygroup-id>1159</hostsecuritygroup-id> <name>"Test Name"</name> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. hostsecuritygroup-id[Required] Identifier for the hostsecuritygroup to be updated. name[Required] New name of the hostsecuritygroup.
2. Sets the host mode data.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>set</command> <category>hostsecuritygroup</category> <process-id>update-host-security-group</process-id> <command-arguments> <hostsecuritygroup-id>1159</hostsecuritygroup-id> <storageclientsetting-id>1234</storageclientsetting-id> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. hostsecuritygroup-id[Required] Identifier for the hostsecuritygroup to be updated. storageclientsetting-id[Required] Identifier for the storage client setting.
3. Adds specified volumes to the host security group specified.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>add</command> <category>hostsecuritygroup</category> <process-id>update-host-security-group</process-id> <command-arguments> <hostsecuritygroup-id>1159</hostsecuritygroup-id> <deviceaccess-ids>0 2</deviceaccess-ids> <volume-ids>1001 1002</volume-ids> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. hostsecuritygroup-id[Required] Identifier for the hostsecuritygroup to be updated. volume-ids[Required] List of ids of volumes to be added. Ids should be separated by space. deviceaccess-ids[Required] list of volume access rights for each volume specified by list of volume-ids.
Note: For each volume specified, user must provide one of the following numbers to indicate the access type: 0: Unknown access 2: Read-write 3: Read-only 4: No access
4. Adds specified initiator WWNs to the host security group specified.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>add</command> <category>hostsecuritygroup</category> <process-id>update-host-security-group</process-id> <command-arguments> <hostsecuritygroup-id>1159</hostsecuritygroup-id> <hbaport-ids>1001 1002</hbaport-ids> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. hostsecuritygroup-id[Required] Identifier for the hostsecuritygroup to be updated. hbaport-ids[Required] List of HBA port IDs or initiators for the host to be added.
5. Removes specified volumes from the protocol controller specified.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>remove</command> <category>hostsecuritygroup</category> <process-id>update-host-security-group</process-id> <command-arguments> <hostsecuritygroup-id>1159</hostsecuritygroup-id> <volume-ids>1001 1002</volume-ids> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. hostsecuritygroup-id[Required] Identifier for the hostsecuritygroup to be updated. volume-ids[Required] List of ids of volumes to be removed. Ids should be separated by space.
6. Removes specified initiator WWNs from the protocol controller specified.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>remove</command> <category>hostsecuritygroup</category> <process-id>update-host-security-group</process-id> <command-arguments> <hostsecuritygroup-id>1159</hostsecuritygroup-id> <hbaport-ids>1001 1002</hbaport-ids> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. hostsecuritygroup-id[Required] Identifier for the hostsecuritygroup to be updated. hbaport-ids[Required] List of HBA port IDs or initiators for the host to be removed.

documentation.description:
This wrapper supports the following requirements:-
1. Sets or changes the name of the host security group. 2. Sets the host mode data. 3. Adds specified volumes to the host security group specified. 4. Adds specified initiator WWNs to the host security group specified. 5. Removes specified volumes from the protocol controller specified. 6. Removes specified initiator WWNs from the protocol controller specified.
